description.plain:
In her Island Records profile, Petite Meller is described as:

…a singer-songwriter, producing Nuvo-Jazzy pop in French and English. Leading it with angelic childlike vocals, oddly enough compared to a post-modern Mia Farrow with a Brigitte Bardot allure.

Meller found her musical footing as the keyboardist and background singer for Israeli electro band Terry Poison, before taking a step into the unknown in 2012 and beginning the “P E T I T E” project. On 11 August 2012, Meller released her first solo track in the form of a cover of Vanessa Paradis' “Joe La Taxi”. After releasing several more solo tracks, such as “PC” and “Icebear”, Meller received moderate commercial success with her track “Backpack.” The track saw a video, directed by A.T. Mann and Napoleon Habeica, which was nominated for “Best European Music Video” at the 2014 Cannes Film Festival. Two years after its release, the video had garnered 425,000 views.

Having found a way into the spotlight, Meller featured in multiple magazines and fashion shoots before returning with “Baby Love” in January 2015. The track went viral due to its vibrant and exotic video, shot in Africa and inspired by Brigitte Bardot’s 1956 film And God Created Woman. A year and a half after the video has premiered, it had already amassed 8 million views.

“Baby Love” was the first glimpse at Meller’s 2016 debut album Lil Empire, and was followed up with the equally as exuberant tracks “Barbaric”“ and “Milk Bath”, as well as a collaboration with Australian dance duo Pnau, “Lil' Love” and Mongolian flute led “The Flute”.

description.plain:
“Baby Love” is a single from French pop singer Petite Meller. The music video was released on Jan 19. 2015 and the track is set to be officially released in April.

According to Petite Meller in an interview with ThisNewBand, “It’s about a broken heart and a hysterical woman dancing the pain away. … Exemplify the essence of life and what love means.”

songs.embed_content: Read “Baby Love” by Petite Meller on Genius
songs.title: Baby Love

body.plain:
“Baby Love” is a single from French pop singer Petite Meller. The music video was released on Jan 19. 2015 and the track is set to be officially released in April.

According to Petite Meller in an interview with ThisNewBand, “It’s about a broken heart and a hysterical woman dancing the pain away. … Exemplify the essence of life and what love means.”

description.plain:
“Milk Bath” is about a boy’s desire for a girl, and the girl’s desire for him to turn his fantasies into reality.

In a Facebook post, Petite Meller gave some context on this song:

The first thing you need when you’re born in life is Milk. It comes to you and goes away. What if you could swim in a bath full of all your needs? That would be a surplus of enjoyment, close to a psychotic seizure, in French: “Jouissance”, the danger in the pleasure of meeting the réal. “Milk Bath” is a request from a girl to a boy to stop fantasising and come and meet her in reality, as she is left alone waiting in his fantasy

The video for “Milk Bath” combines science and music. Meller and her team reached out to scientists at Cornell University to help find locations for the video shoot. When they decided to shoot at Lake Retba in Senegal, the university asked Meller and her team to take a sample from the lake to aid in their research into what turned the lake pink.

songs.embed_content: Read “Milk Bath” by Petite Meller on Genius
songs.title: Milk Bath

songs.lyrics:

This love is gonna get me down, down
This love is gonna get me-

[Chorus]
I'll wait up, my clothes off, in milk bath
I'll blow your head up with a whisper
Please wake up, and reach out
Boy won't you play with me for real
Boy won't you play with me for real

[Verse 2]
But in the heat of the hour
My love should have expired
When you blow your hair in the dryer
Fools can see beneath your swagger
Straight up, you're killing the fun part
I'm here waiting you reach out
Wouldn't it feel dirty but alive
To hold my ribs tight?

[Pre-Chorus]
Coming to get you, coming to get you
This love is gonna get me down, down
This love is gonna get me-

[Chorus]
I'll wait up, my clothes off, in milk bath
I'll blow your head up with a whisper
Please wake up, and reach out
Boy won't you play with me for real
Boy won't you play with me for real

[Bridge]
My teeth don't work
And my heartbeat's frail
And my eyes wide red
They've been sailing the sealing
I'll be your prey
While I'm drying my feathers
I cough with each phrase
Well there's no more to say now

[Post-Bridge]
Oo-wo, a-wey ah
Oo-wo, o-adagio

[Chorus]
I'll wait up, my clothes off, in milk bath
I'll blow your head up with a whisper
Please wake up, and reach out
Boy won't you play with me for-
I'll wait up, my clothes off, in milk bath
I'll blow your head up with a whisper
Boy won't you play with me for real
Boy won't you play with me for real

description.plain:
“The Flute” is the final promotional release from Petite Meller in the run up to her 2016 debut album Lil Empire. The track and accompanying video (directed by Meller’s frequent collaborators A T Mann and Napoleon Habeica) was premiered exlusively by NME on 18 August 2016 and saw Meller and her team travel out to rural Mongolia.

The video features Meller along with several Northern Nomad community members, notably a child (named Tuya) with naturally blushed cheeks, similar to Meller’s own (albeit Meller’s is the result of makeup).

Petite described the reasoning behind the choice of location in a short interview with NME to accompany the premiere:

“I remember how as a child I saw a photo of a blushed Mongolian girl and felt a strange connection. Filming began after a 13-hour cross-country drive and a horseback ride to reach the Northern Nomads, the girls with natural blush, the sumo guys and the reindeers. We had no Wi-Fi, no phone reception, just beautiful animals and endless grass.”

Many of the costumes used in the video were on loan from the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Antwerp, Belgium, including a dress made predominately from straw (which can be seen in the track’s single artwork) and various assorted hats.

songs.embed_content: Read “The Flute” by Petite Meller on Genius
songs.title: The Flute

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Feeling like a fool
Just l'm on my own
Chilling in the sauna
Try to heat my bones
Feeling like the sun
Above no zone
Didn't think to clean the mirror
Since you're gone

[Pre-Chorus]
I've been in love
This kind of love that makes you
Saying, why I need this love?

[Chorus]
Where can I go
Who can I be
Looking at my day and I just long to see
You don't let go
I cannot breathe
We can have a party, baby
Wait and see

[Verse 2]
Counting all the stairs
Behind your door
Never knew somebody
I could feel secure
Preaching I'm a sinner
Who praise your lord
You can fool me darling
Baby, ain't no more

[Pre-Chorus]
I'll sing it loud
Wherever I will go
Singing, all I need is love

[Chorus]
Where can I go
Who can I be
Looking at my day and I just long to see
You don't let go
I cannot breathe
We can have a party, baby
Wait and see

[Bridge]
Put your hands on me now
Put your hands on
Put your hands on me now
Lay your head on

[Chorus x3]
Where can I go
Who can I be
Looking at my day and I just long to see
You don't let go
I cannot breathe
We can have a party, baby
Wait and see

[Outro]
This time, baby
Where can I go

description.plain:
This is the second song Petite Meller has released since announcing she will likely release an album in 2016 besides a cover of the Velvet Underground’s “Sunday Morning” she recorded with Børns for an H&M commercial. The title refers to the Freudian concept of innate barbarism.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T08o0FD1MoM

Meller works with a different producer for each single. As she told i-D:

“With every producer I get a lot of interpretations of my genre. You could say that I have my own language and each producer speaks it with a different accent. I also learn a lot from them. I got my upbeat disco from Swedish producer Jocke Åhlund, African choirs from Craigie Dodds, who is South African, and an Australian touch from Pnau.”

songs.title: Barbaric

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Don't you miss me baby
Every time you walk away
Walking to another planet
Ain't no drama baby
I just want you here to stay
Walking to another

[Refrain]
Never been in love
Never been a part of
Put your loving arms
That's where I belong boy

[Verse 2]
Keep on searching brother
Something will come on your way
Step into a brand new future
Everything you're saying
Love is only what you make
Walking to each other

[Refrain]
Never been in love
Never been a part of
Put your loving arms
That's where I belong boy

[Chorus]
How do you feel without a little love
For me tonight?
(x4)

[Bridge]
Darling, I want you to know, that I care
And that the memories we've made
Will remain and live on-
Forever (reach out, forever) [x12]

[Chorus]
How do you feel without a little love
For me tonight?
(x4)

[Outro]
Don't you ever really miss me baby
I don't wanna fall in love each time
Don't you ever really miss me baby
I don't wanna be with a different guy
I don't wanna love that messed up baby
I don't wanna be with a different guy
I don't wanna love that lasts in maybe
These are all the things I've left behind

description.plain:
Petite said this about ‘Backpack’ in a 2015 interview with EveningStandard:

‘For example, my song ‘Backpack’ — I studied Freud and Lacan, so it’s about what you’re carrying in your backpack, like symptoms from childhood, things that were your trauma. Just wear it. Like when you grow up, you get to a point where you should feel… I felt this; that I can wear my trauma proudly.’

songs.title: Backpack

[Verse 1]
Just like breaking in the middle of
Hanging out sounds so familiar

And it comes with a backpack devotion
And you know it slipped off my shoulder
Gave all I had for nothing at all

[Chorus]

Think of time physically
I can finally
Think of love easily, yeah

[Verse 2]
Was a time I met the superior
He just bent over my shoulder
Used to pray, hope for a miracle
Two thumbs up for making me cynical

[Pre-Chorus]

And it comes with a backpack devotion

Gave all I had for nothing at all

[Chorus]
I can finally
Think of time physically
I can finally
Think of love easily, yeah
(x2)

[Bridge]
Better be cruising on tonight
Ain’t gonna be no slip 'n slide
Even if I lose you mama
Gonna shake that blues tonight
Thinking about the alphabet
Trying to play myself up dead
You should do something
Just instead of, fill those tears tonight
(x2)

[Chorus]
I can finally
Think of time physically
I can finally
Think of love easily, yeah
(x2)

description.plain:
“Argentina” is the tenth track from French singer-songwriter Petite Meller’s 2016 debut album Lil Empire and features production credits from Swedish producer Joakim “Jocke” Åhlund.

“Argentina” is a summery pop track overlayed with airy vocals from Meller.

songs.title: Argentina

body.plain:
“Argentina” is the tenth track from French singer-songwriter Petite Meller’s 2016 debut album Lil Empire and features production credits from Swedish producer Joakim “Jocke” Åhlund.

“Argentina” is a summery pop track overlayed with airy vocals from Meller.

description.plain:
“Geez” details an intimate encounter between a mob boss and a tap dancer, the latter of whom’s talent reduces the stereotypically affectless mob boss to tears.

Meller performed the track numerous times before its release at her shows. It features writing and production credits from Brighton-born Tim Larcombe, previously known for writing and producing several tracks from American singer Lana Del Rey’s major label debut Born To Die and it’s re-release Paradise, as well as the track “Strange Love” by Halsey from her 2015 debut Badlands.

songs.title: Geez

How will they know if they don't come for me

Lord, you never bleed
I just need some heat
I poll dancing to the beat
When I'm incomplete
Got me hiding in
I just slide and sleep
I get hungry for your heat

I'll get you excited boy
You might burst into tears
I'll be your delusion boy

Come on (x5)
Yeah (x4)
Come on (x5)

[Chorus]
Breathe
I'll get you excited boy
You might burst into tears
I'll be your delusion boy

(x2)

songs.title: Hawaii

description.plain:
“America” explores a desire to reach America, possibly written from the viewpoint of an immigrant/refugee or at least inspired by the dreams of many immigrants/refugees from poorer, more oppressive countries. For them the concept of America is synonymous with a better life, so many are prepared to sacrifice everything in order to get there. The sample of young children chanting played throughout the song represents the joy associated with the prosperity America represents.

Meller hinted that she’d been working with Justin Parker and Fred Ball in a deleted tweet written in early December 2015, with “America” being the supposed outcome.

songs.embed_content: Read “America” by Petite Meller on Genius
songs.title: America

songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
L'amour, l'amour America
L'amour, l'amour America

[Verse 1]
And you can feel it growing
On my skin it's burning up inside of me
Where are all the things you've did and said and done
I basically just disagreed
Would you believe in something
That your mama told you you could never be
Cause probably she got It wrong
And didn't notice what Columbus did

[Pre-Chorus]
But there's something I can't explain
Looking but nobody's saying
When no word can heal my pain
Cause no one only we

[Chorus]
We don't look back
Won't give up
We're gonna go to America
Way up high, you and I
We're gonna make it happen
We don't look back
Won't give up
We're gonna go to America

[Post-Chorus]
L'amour, l'amour America
L'amour, l'amour America

[Verse 2]
How can you tell me what it’s like
To travel if you’re not a pioneer
I appreciated all the dreams you had
They basically just disappeared

[Pre-Chorus]
But there's something I can't explain
Looking but nobody's saying
When no word can heal my pain
Cause no one only we

[Chorus]
We don't look back
Won't give up
We're gonna go to America
Way up high, you and I
We're gonna make it happen
We don't look back
Won't give up
We're gonna go to America

[Bridge]
We're going to- America (x3)
We're going to- believe it
Cause no one only we

[Chorus]
We don't look back
Won't give up
We're gonna go to America
Way up high, you and I
We're gonna make it happen
We don't look back
Won't give up
We're gonna go to America

description.plain:
“Grace” features a minimal underlying instrumental overlaid with light, stripped back vocals. The track was written and gifted to Meller by American artist Shamir, who Meller claims thought the song was “made for [her]”.

Lyrically, Meller compares her lover to the light of God, his kisses making her life bright once again, albeit momentarily. She tries to avoid him because, while his presence makes her feel temporarily elated, she knows that there’s darkness at the end, so she keeps moving.

The track ends with a spoken-word poem written and read by Meller herself in her native French. The poem was previously featured at the beginning of the “Backpack” music video.

description.plain:
After a three-year hiatus following the release of her debut album, Lil Empire, Petite Meller returns with “Aeroplane”.

“Aeroplane” sees frequent collaborator Jocke Åhlund once again tackling the production: a Paul Simon-inspired, Afro/Latin/Europop celebration of life above the clouds.

songs.embed_content: Read “Aeroplane” by Petite Meller on Genius
songs.title: Aeroplane

body.plain:
After a three-year hiatus following the release of her debut album, Lil Empire, Petite Meller returns with “Aeroplane”.

“Aeroplane” sees frequent collaborator Jocke Åhlund once again tackling the production: a Paul Simon-inspired, Afro/Latin/Europop celebration of life above the clouds.

songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
Cabin crew please be seated for take off
Ladies and gentlemen, air flight entertainment is about to begin
For further details please refer to your copy of...

[Chorus]
The way my body goes, high and low, around the globe
The way my body goes, like an aeroplane, coast to coast
The way my body goes, high and low, around the globe
The way my body goes, like an aeroplane, coast to coast

[Verse 1]
I go in it with my ticket, frequent flyer on the aeroplane
On my window, no reflection, all I need is resurrection
What I’m feeling, what I’m thinking, can you see it, can you say it?

[Pre-Chorus: Malcolm McCarthy]
(I’m not waiting till you want me
Got the rhythm in my body)
We smile, you stick, you define me now
Going off to my inner soul, my soul divided
If you’d be cool, define me
O-oh

[Chorus]
The way my body goes, high and low, around the globe
The way my body goes, like an aeroplane, coast to coast
The way my body goes, high and low, around the globe
The way my body goes, like an aeroplane, coast to coast

[Verse 2]
I got real levitation, flying over every nation
Speedy jet plane, my vacation, till I reach my destination

[Pre-Chorus: Malcolm McCarthy]
(Inner soul, my soul divided
If you’d be cool, define me
O-oh)

[Chorus]
The way my body goes, high and low, around the globe
The way my body goes, like an aeroplane, coast to coast
The way my body goes, high and low, around the globe
The way my body goes, like an aeroplane, coast to coast

[Bridge]
Haiti, Malawi, Brasília, Barbados
You know that I love you
Ya sabes, te quiero
Armenia, Bolivia, Colombia, Namibia
Whoever you find on your way, sing it “yeah”
I'm walking the wire, I got to go higher
Inside the desire, the music is fire
The way that we fly, make us shine like sapphires
The way my body goes Like an aeroplane, coast to coast
The way my body goes Like an aeroplane, coast to coast
The way my body goes, like an aeroplane, coast to coast
The way my body goes, like an aeroplane, coast to coast

[Chorus]
The way my body goes, high and low, around the globe
The way my body goes, like an aeroplane, coast to coast
The way my body goes, high and low, around the globe
The way my body goes, like an aeroplane, coast to coast

[Post-Chorus]
(O-oh, o-oh
O-oh, like an aeroplane
Like an aeroplane)
[?]
(O-oh, like an aeroplane)
[?]

[Outro]
Do jeito que meu corpo vai, alto e baixo pela costa
Do jeito que meu corpo mexe como um avião pra cima e pra baixo

description.plain:
Meller originally wrote “Conspiracy” as a lullaby for her grandmother, before releasing the demo as a free download for those who signed up to her online newsletter.

The track was also released as a B-side on the limited edition vinyl pressing of her 2012 hit “NYC Time.”

songs.embed_content: Read “Conspiracy (Demo)” by Petite Meller on Genius
songs.title: Conspiracy (Demo)

body.plain:
Meller originally wrote “Conspiracy” as a lullaby for her grandmother, before releasing the demo as a free download for those who signed up to her online newsletter.

The track was also released as a B-side on the limited edition vinyl pressing of her 2012 hit “NYC Time.”

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
When, you have to go
I feel a bug inside of us, overflow
When, you have to go
I'll feel you apologise
I have to know

[Pre-Chorus]
Let me, let me be
Let me die
Hold me, hold me close
Make me high

[Chorus]
But I guess I’ll see you there
Throw your hands up in the air
Throw your hands up in the air
But I guess I’ll see you there
Throw your hands up in the air
Throw your hands up in the air
But I guess I’ll see you there
Throw your hands up in the air
Throw your hands up in the air
But I guess I’ll see you there
Throw your hands up in the air

[Post-Chorus]
Ooh
Oh, ooh

[Verse 2]
When, you have to go
I'll breathe you out, my baby, I
I'm fading slow

[Pre-Chorus]
Let me, let me be
Let me die
Hold me, hold me close
Make me high

[Chorus]
But I guess I’ll see you there
Throw your hands up in the air
Throw your hands up in the air
But I guess I’ll see you there
Throw your hands up in the air
Throw your hands up in the air
But I guess I’ll see you there
Throw your hands up in the air
Throw your hands up in the air
But I guess I’ll see you there
Throw your hands up in the air

songs.lyrics:
[Intro: Petite Meller & Joe Fleisch]
Da-da-da-da
Eisbär
Oh eisbär
Eisbär
Oh eisbär
Kaltes Eis
Kaltes Eis
Eisbär
Eisbär

[Verse 1: Joe Fleisch]
Ich möchte ein Eisbär sein, [?] kalten Polar
Dann müßte ich nicht mehr schrei'n
Alles wär' so klar

[Verse 2: Petite Meller]
Ich möchte ein Eisbär sein, [?] kalten Polar
Dann müßte ich nicht mehr schrei'n
Alles wär' so klar

[Chorus: Petite Meller & Joe Fleisch]
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen

[Verse 3: Petite Meller]
Ich möchte ein Eisbär sein, [?] kalten Polar
Dann müßte ich nicht mehr schrei'n
Alles wär' so klar

[Verse 4: Joe Fleisch]
Ich möchte ein Eisbär sein, [?] kalten Polar
Dann müßte ich nicht mehr schrei'n
Alles wär' so klar

[Chorus: Petite Meller & Joe Fleisch]
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen
Eisbär'n müssen nie weinen

[Outro: Joe Fleisch]
(Ich möchte ein Eisbär sein, [?] kalten Polar
Dann müßte ich nicht mehr schrei'n
Alles wär' so klar)

description.plain: “Out of Focus” has only ever been performed live during select shows throughout 2013, notably at Pianos on 24th October, 2013, during which the only footage of the track was captured. The producer, co-writers and final title are unknown, however the title is speculated to be “Out of Focus”.

description.plain:
“Stevie Jobs” is an independent single released by Meller and features a guest verse from Israeli dancer and rapper Shamel Pitts. The track was released alongside a video directed by frequent collaborator Asaf Mann.

The video, filmed in an old Bauhaus house in Tel Aviv, features Meller and Pitts starring alongside several Tel Avivian models. Russian designer Michael Polkanov and UK sports apparel company New Balance aided in its creation.

https://vimeo.com/103407535

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Joe le taxi
Y va pas partout
Y marche pas au soda
Son saxo jaune
Connaît toutes les rues par coeur

[Pre-Chorus]
Tous les p'tits bars
Tous les coins noirs
Et la Seine
Et ses ponts qui brillent

[Chorus]
Joe le taxi
C'est sa vie
Le rhum au mambo
Embouteillage
Joe le taxi
C'est sa vie
Le rhum au mambo
Embouteillage

[Verse 2]
Dans sa caise
La musique à Joe résonne
C'est la rumba
Le vieux rock au mambo bidon
Vas-y Joe
Vas-y Joe
Vas-y fonce
Dans la nuit vers l'amazone

[Pre-Chorus]
Tous les p'tits bars
Tous les coins noirs
Et la Seine
Et ses ponts qui brillent

[Chorus]
Joe le taxi
C'est sa vie
Le rhum au mambo
Embouteillage
Joe le taxi
C'est sa vie
Le rhum au mambo
Embouteillage

[Verse 3]
Dans sa caise
La musique à Joe résonne
C'est la rumba
Le vieux rock au mambo bidon
Vas-y Joe
Vas-y Joe
Vas-y fonce
Dans la nuit vers l'amazone

songs.title: Sunday Morning [Animal Serenade]

songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
Look up, baby
It's morning

[Chorus]
Sunday morning
Praise the dawning
It’s just a restless feeling
By my side

[Post-Chorus]
Early dawning
Sunday morning
It's just the wasted years
So close behind

[Verse]
Watch out the world's behind you
There’s always someone around you
Who will call
It's nothing at all
Nothing, nothing at all

[Chorus]
Sunday morning
And I'm falling
I've got a feeling
I don't want to know

[Post-Chorus]
Early dawning
Sunday morning
It's all the streets you've crossed
Not long ago

[Verse]
Watch out the world's behind you
There’s always someone around you
Who will call
It’s nothing at all
Nothing, nothing at all

[Bridge]
[?]
J'adore, [?]
Dimanche, [?]
[?], pour moi

[Verse]
Watch out the world’s behind you
There's always someone around you
Who will call
It's nothing at all
Nothing, nothing, nothing at all

[Outro]
Sunday morning
Sunday morning
Sunday morning

songs.title_with_featured: Comme Ci Comme Ca (Ft. Petite Meller)

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Vous êtes marié
C'est tres difficile
Je t'aime bien sur mais je peur aussi (aussi)
Tu viens ce soir?
Je ne suis pas pre'te
Donne moi une minute pour arranger ma tête

[Chorus]
Toi (ah-ah)
Comme ci comme ca (ah-ah)
A chaque fois (ah-ah)
(Oh)

[Verse 2]
Tombé la neige
Et je me froid
Juste viens ici, et dormir avec moi
J'ai seize ans
Tu est trop vieux
Si tu veux ta voiture nous amène hors du monde

[Chorus]
Toi (ah-ah)
Comme ci comme ca (ah-ah)
Je ris du toi (ah-ah)
(Oh)

[Bridge]
(Vocal adlibs)

[Chorus]
Toi (ah-ah)
Comme ci comme ca (ah-ah)
A chaque fois (ah-ah)
Quoi (ah-ah)
(Oh)
